MAN.TITLE: find
MAN.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: find indices of boolean vector or matrix true elements

PARAM_ITEM.PARAM_DESCRIPTION: : a boolean vector or a boolean matrix or a "standard" matrix
: an integer giving the maximum number of indices to return. The default value is -1 which stands for "all". This option can be used for efficiency, to avoid searching all indices.
: integer vectors of indices or empty matrices

DESCRIPTION.P: If x is a boolean matrix,
ii=find(x) returns the vector of indices i for which x(i) is "true". If no true element found find returns an empty matrix.
[ir,ic]=find(x) returns two vectors of indices ir (for rows) and ic (for columns) such that x(ir(n),ic(n)) is "true". If no true element found find returns empty matrices in ir and ic.
if x is standard matrix find(x) is interpreted as find(x<>0)
